text: Alison Lurie (September 3, 1926December 3, 2020) was an American novelist and academic. She won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction for her 1984 novel Foreign Affairs. She was born in Chicago, Illinois. Lurie died on December 3, 2020 in Ithaca, New York at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American novelists Category:Educators from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Pulitzer Prize winners
